      <div class="field field-name-field-person-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://www.si.umich.edu/sites/default/files/styles/profile/public/julia_am.jpg?itok=cApoYhx7" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field-group-format group_main field-group-div group-main  speed-none effect-none"><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h2>Julia Adler-Milstein</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-office field-type-text-long field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Office: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">105 S. State Street</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-phone field-type-text field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Phone: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">734/763-2285</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-email field-type-email field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Email: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="mailto:juliaam@umich.edu">juliaam@umich.edu</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-titles field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Adjunct Associate Professor of Information and Research Investigator, School of Information</div></div></div></div><div class="field-group-accordion-wrapper field-group-accordion group-display  effect-none"><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Biography</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Julia Adler-Milstein is an Associate Professor at the School of Information with a joint appointment in the School of Public Health (Health Management and Policy). Dr. Adler-Milstein is a national expert on policy and management issues related to the use of IT in healthcare delivery. Her research assesses the progress of health IT adoption; the impact of such adoption on healthcare costs and quality; and the relationships between market, organizational, and team structure and health IT use.  A core focus of her work is on health information exchange and interoperability. Dr. Adler-Milstein holds a Ph.D. in health policy from Harvard University. Her private-sector experience includes the Center for IT Leadership at Partners Healthcare in Boston and in the Health and Life Sciences Division of Accenture. </p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Areas of interest</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-areas "><div class="field field-name-field-person-interest field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Please visit: <a href="http://healthit.si.umich.edu/" rel="nofollow">http://healthit.si.umich.edu/</a></p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Honors & Awards</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-honors "><div class="field field-name-field-person-honors field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>- Outstanding Dissertation Award; Academy Health</p>
<p>- Carnegie Junior Faculty Development Fellowship; University of Michigan</p>
<p>- Top 10 Influential Women in Health IT, Fierce Health IT</p>
<p>- American Medical Informatics Association New Investigator Award</p>
<p>- Seema S. Sonnad Emerging Leader in Managed Care Research Award, American Journal of Managed Care</p>
<p>- Henry Russel Award for Outstanding Junior Faculty, University of Michigan</p>
<p>- Impact Accelerator Award, Institute for Health Policy and Innovation, University of Michigan</p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Education</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-education "><div class="field field-name-field-profile-education field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">PhD, Health Policy, Harvard University </div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Research Projects</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-research "><div class="field field-name-research-projects field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="view view-research view-id-research view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-56ed171ce6aaf5394b350eefcb4c0b5d">

    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Tawfiq Ammari earned a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Jordan. He later earned his Masters degree from the University of Michigan School of Information in 2013. After working as a research assistant at UMSI for a year, he was accepted to the PhD program at UMSI. He is interested in parenting and social media use. He is also interested in the use of social media by parents of children with special needs.</p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Areas of interest</h3>

    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>As the School Registrar, I am responsible for coordinating curriculum and class scheduling each term and keeping classes updated in Wolverine Access for all UMSI degree programs. I monitor enrollment during registration periods and work with students for any of their registration needs; such as, approving course waivers, drop/add requests, transfer of credit and cognate requests. I also provide student data reporting for internal and external purposes.</p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Education</h3>

      <div class="field field-name-field-person-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://www.si.umich.edu/sites/default/files/styles/profile/public/apsley_debbie_072214.jpg?itok=sNhDqafJ" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field-group-format group_main field-group-div group-main  speed-none effect-none"><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h2>Deborah Apsley</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-office field-type-text-long field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Office: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">4341 North Quad</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-phone field-type-text field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Phone: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">734/936-9802</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-email field-type-email field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Email: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="mailto:apsley@umich.edu">apsley@umich.edu</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-titles field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Director of Human Resources and Support Services</div></div></div></div><div class="field-group-accordion-wrapper field-group-accordion group-display  effect-none"><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Biography</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>I manage staff members who support UMSI human resources, facilities, faculty and leadership support, events management, and special projects. I am in charge of all academic and staff human resources at UMSI. In addition, I work with other senior staff to manage business affairs and school operations.</p>
<p>I am working towards certification to become a certified Strengths Coach.  My Top 5 strengths are:</p>
<p>Harmony * Relator * Arranger * Responsibility * Individualization
</p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Education</h3>

	<div id="content-inside">
      <div class="field field-name-field-person-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://www.si.umich.edu/sites/default/files/styles/profile/public/732A3397.jpg?itok=yG-tMJUg" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field-group-format group_main field-group-div group-main  speed-none effect-none"><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h2>Seyram Avle</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-office field-type-text-long field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Office: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">4341 North Quad</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-phone field-type-text field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Phone: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">734/647-5443</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-email field-type-email field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Email: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="mailto:seyram@umich.edu">seyram@umich.edu</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-titles field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Research Investigator, Information and Research Fellow, School of Information</div></div></div></div><div class="field-group-accordion-wrapper field-group-accordion group-display  effect-none"><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Areas of interest</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-areas "><div class="field field-name-field-person-interest field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>My research critically examines the situated practices and discourses of digital technologies/media in and from the global south. My goal is to provide empirically rigorous and theoretically robust explanations for the ways that digital technologies are being designed and used around the world. To accomplish this, I study 1) technology entrepreneurship and production 2) the interfacing of digital media and traditional media in parts of Africa and China.</p>
<p>My website <a href="http://www.seyramavle.com" rel="nofollow">www.seyramavle.com</a> has more details on my research and publications.</p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Education</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-education "><div class="field field-name-field-profile-education field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">BA, Brandeis University </div><div class="field-item odd">PhD, University of Michigan</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Research Projects</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-research "><div class="field field-name-research-projects field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="view view-research view-id-research view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-65f910a1f2e2f1a4105229b9c753c78d">

    <div id="content" class="column panel" role="main">
	<div id="content-inside">
      <div class="field field-name-field-person-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://www.si.umich.edu/sites/default/files/styles/profile/public/bloom_008-3x4-crop.jpg?itok=2eeM5bMB" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field-group-format group_main field-group-div group-main  speed-none effect-none"><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h2>David Bloom</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-office field-type-text-long field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Office: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">4322 North Quad</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-phone field-type-text field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Phone: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">734/763-2285</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-email field-type-email field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Email: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="mailto:dcbloom@umich.edu">dcbloom@umich.edu</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-titles field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Adjunct Clinical Associate Professor of Information, School of Information</div></div></div></div><div class="field-group-accordion-wrapper field-group-accordion group-display  effect-none"><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Biography</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Faculty Profile<br />David Bloom: Now in his fifth career</p>
<p>David Bloom doesn’t sweat failure. Why? Because he’s an entrepreneur. <br /><br />Bloom has built 13 start-ups – new business ventures from the ground-up. A high-speed digital library system, a big-data analytics company, and a handheld diabetes manager, among (many) others. <br /><br />Of these, “a third of them are gone,” Bloom says casually. <br /><br />For most of us, failure is anything but casual. But for people like Bloom, failure comes with the territory, because entrepreneurs think out-of-the box -- “it’s part of the job description,” Bloom says. This means they can’t stop trying new things; some are bound to fail.  <br /><br />This kind of life would drive many people crazy, but “we’re not motivated by the things that motivate most folks,” explains Bloom, adjunct clinical associate professor of information, and UMSI’s most recent faculty member. <br />“We have to practice delayed gratification,” he says, “use the best science to take our best shot, then find out later – sometimes way later – if we got it right.” At this, his grin expands. <br /><br />Bloom is teaching SI 663: Entrepreneurship in the Information Industry in Winter 2018. He previously taught at the Ross School of Business for several years, at the Rackham Graduate School and LS&A.<br />Bloom grew up in the city of Detroit. In high school, he was a music geek, he says. He played keyboards and sang in the choir. So he went to Oberlin College in Ohio to major in music composition. It was his first lesson in failure, he says, and it wasn’t an easy one: He flunked out. <br /><br />“I learned there are some really great composers out there—and I ain’t one of ’em,” he says. <br /><br />He did an about-face to earn degrees in electrical engineering and industrial and operations engineering from the University of Michigan. Early on, he worked for the Burroughs Corporation (now Unisys) as a staff engineer. It was there that he became a teacher – “an evangelist,” as he puts it – about a promising new technology. “It was called ‘email’.”<br /><br />Bloom, who lives in Chelsea, MI. with his family, adds that teaching at U-M is his fifth career, preceded by roles as engineer, project manager, coach, and journalist (he started the site <a href="http://www.arborweb.com">www.arborweb.com</a> while at the Ann Arbor Observer in 1996; it’s still in operation). <br /><br />Along the way, he has had some great mentors – and is now a mentor himself. Meanwhile, Bloom loves his role as teacher at UMSI, he says. “Working with the students here at UMSI is intrinsically motivating. They expect a lot of us. They should.” </p>
<p>by Sheryl James for umsi.life</p>
</div></div></div></div></div></div>

State Street</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-phone field-type-text field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Phone: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">734/763-2285</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-email field-type-email field-label-inline clearfix"><div class="field-label">Email: </div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="mailto:lbozarth@umich.edu">lbozarth@umich.edu</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-person-titles field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">PhD student</div></div></div></div><div class="field-group-accordion-wrapper field-group-accordion group-display  effect-none"><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Biography</h3>
    <div class="field-group-format-wrapper field-group-accordion-item group-biography "><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Hi, I'm Lia. I grew up in the West Coast and earned my bachelors in computer science from the University of Washington, Seattle. Post undergrad, I worked in the industry (Amazon & Google) as a software engineer for a few years. I'm currently a 2nd year doctoral student with research focus on Computational Social Science at University of Michigan, School of Information. My advisor is Ceren Budak.</p>
<p>You can find more information about me at my website: <a href="http://www.lbozarth.com" rel="nofollow">lbozarth.com</a></p>
</div></div></div></div><h3 class="field-group-format-toggler accordion-item field-group-accordion-active">Areas of interest</h3>

Computational Social Science<br />
Data Mining<br />
Natural Language Processing<br />
Network Analysis<br />
Becoming a Homeless Comedian</p>
</div></div></div></div></div></div>
